article.title: Properties of the light quarks and antiquarks in the statistical approach

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main focus of the quantum statistical parton distributions approach described in the article?
choices: Analyzing the behavior of heavy quarks and antiquarks.
Studying the interactions between quarks and gluons.
Imposing relations between quarks and antiquarks to understand their properties.
Calculating the mass of the Higgs boson.

multiple_choice_question.text: The article mentions that the fermion distributions are described by two terms. What are these terms?
choices: A Gaussian distribution and a wave function.
A quasi Fermi-Dirac function and a helicity-independent diffractive contribution.
An electromagnetic potential and a strong force potential.
A gravitational field and a quantum fluctuation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the hierarchy observed in the potential components (X) for light quarks?
choices: It contradicts the Standard Model of particle physics.
It indicates the presence of a new fundamental force.
It leads to a specific hierarchy in the quark helicity distributions and flavor asymmetry.
It suggests that quarks are not fundamental particles.

multiple_choice_question.text: What experimental observation supports the predictions made by the statistical approach regarding flavor asymmetry?
choices: The discovery of the Higgs boson.
The measurement of the top quark mass.
The monotonic increase of the ratio  xd(x, Q²)/xū(x, Q²) observed in experiments.
